CREATE TABLE public.items (
    id integer DEFAULT nextval('items_id_seq'::regclass) NOT NULL,
    name text NOT NULL,
    name_arabic text,
    description text,
    description_arabic text,
    category text NOT NULL,
    category_arabic text,
    price double precision NOT NULL,
    calories integer DEFAULT 0 NOT NULL,
    protein_g integer DEFAULT 0 NOT NULL,
    carbs_g integer DEFAULT 0 NOT NULL,
    fat_g integer DEFAULT 0 NOT NULL,
    max_free_per_meal integer DEFAULT 0 NOT NULL,
    image_url text,
    is_available boolean DEFAULT true NOT NULL,
    sort_order integer DEFAULT 0 NOT NULL,
    created_at timestamp with time zone DEFAULT now() NOT NULL,
    updated_at timestamp with time zone DEFAULT now() NOT NULL,
    is_additive boolean DEFAULT false NOT NULL,
    CONSTRAINT items_pkey PRIMARY KEY (id)
);

  CHECK ((fat_g >= 0))

  CHECK ((max_free_per_meal >= 0))

â€¢ items_price_check (CHECK)
  CHECK ((price >= ((0)::numeric)::double precision))

â€¢ items_protein_g_check (CHECK)
  CHECK ((protein_g >= 0))

â€¢ items_calories_check (CHECK)
  CHECK ((calories >= 0))

â€¢ items_carbs_g_check (CHECK)
  CHECK ((carbs_g >= 0))

  Columns: id
  Definition: CREATE UNIQUE INDEX items_pkey ON public.items USING btree (id)

CREATE TABLE public.meal_reviews (
    id uuid DEFAULT uuid_generate_v4() NOT NULL,
    user_id uuid NOT NULL,
    meal_id integer NOT NULL,
    order_id uuid NOT NULL,
    rating integer NOT NULL,
    review_text text,
    is_verified_purchase boolean DEFAULT true NOT NULL,
    is_published boolean DEFAULT true NOT NULL,
    created_at timestamp with time zone DEFAULT now() NOT NULL,
    updated_at timestamp with time zone DEFAULT now() NOT NULL,
    CONSTRAINT meal_reviews_pkey PRIMARY KEY (id)
);

2ï¸âƒ£  Constraints
-------------------------------------------------
â€¢ meal_reviews_order_id_fkey (FOREIGN KEY)
  FOREIGN KEY (order_id) REFERENCES orders(id) ON DELETE CASCADE

â€¢ meal_reviews_rating_check (CHECK)
  CHECK (((rating >= 1) AND (rating <= 5)))

â€¢ meal_reviews_user_id_meal_id_order_id_key (UNIQUE)
  UNIQUE (user_id, meal_id, order_id)

â€¢ meal_reviews_user_id_fkey (FOREIGN KEY)
  FOREIGN KEY (user_id) REFERENCES user_profiles(id) ON DELETE CASCADE

â€¢ meal_reviews_meal_id_fkey (FOREIGN KEY)
  FOREIGN KEY (meal_id) REFERENCES meals(id) ON DELETE CASCADE

3ï¸âƒ£  Indexes
-------------------------------------------------
â€¢ meal_reviews_pkey (UNIQUE) (PRIMARY KEY)
  Columns: id
  Definition: CREATE UNIQUE INDEX meal_reviews_pkey ON public.meal_reviews USING btree (id)

â€¢ meal_reviews_user_id_meal_id_order_id_key (UNIQUE)
  Columns: user_id, meal_id, order_id
  Definition: CREATE UNIQUE INDEX meal_reviews_user_id_meal_id_order_id_key ON public.meal_reviews USING btree (user_id, meal_id, order_id)

â€¢ idx_meal_reviews_rating
  Columns: meal_id, rating
  Definition: CREATE INDEX idx_meal_reviews_rating ON public.meal_reviews USING btree (meal_id, rating) WHERE (is_published = true)

4ï¸âƒ£  Triggers & Function Definitions
-------------------------------------------------
ðŸ”¥ TRIGGER: trigger_update_meal_rating_insert
   Timing: AFTER
   Events: INSERT
   Function: public.update_meal_rating()

ðŸ“‹ Trigger Definition:
CREATE TRIGGER trigger_update_meal_rating_insert AFTER INSERT ON public.meal_reviews FOR EACH ROW EXECUTE FUNCTION update_meal_rating()

âš™ï¸  Function Definition:
CREATE OR REPLACE FUNCTION public.update_meal_rating()
 RETURNS trigger
 LANGUAGE plpgsql
AS $function$
BEGIN
    UPDATE meals 
    SET 
        rating = (
            SELECT ROUND(AVG(rating)::numeric, 2)
            FROM meal_reviews 
            WHERE meal_id = NEW.meal_id AND is_published = true
        ),
        rating_count = (
            SELECT COUNT(*)
            FROM meal_reviews 
            WHERE meal_id = NEW.meal_id AND is_published = true
        )
    WHERE id = NEW.meal_id;
    
    RETURN NEW;
END;
$function$


---

ðŸ”¥ TRIGGER: trigger_update_meal_rating_update
   Timing: AFTER
   Events: UPDATE
   Function: public.update_meal_rating()

ðŸ“‹ Trigger Definition:
CREATE TRIGGER trigger_update_meal_rating_update AFTER UPDATE ON public.meal_reviews FOR EACH ROW WHEN (((old.rating <> new.rating) OR (old.is_published <> new.is_published))) EXECUTE FUNCTION update_meal_rating()

âš™ï¸  Function Definition:
CREATE OR REPLACE FUNCTION public.update_meal_rating()
 RETURNS trigger
 LANGUAGE plpgsql
AS $function$
BEGIN
    UPDATE meals 
    SET 
        rating = (
            SELECT ROUND(AVG(rating)::numeric, 2)
            FROM meal_reviews 
            WHERE meal_id = NEW.meal_id AND is_published = true
        ),
        rating_count = (
            SELECT COUNT(*)
            FROM meal_reviews 
            WHERE meal_id = NEW.meal_id AND is_published = true
        )
    WHERE id = NEW.meal_id;
    
    RETURN NEW;
END;
$function$

ðŸ”¥ TRIGGER: trigger_update_timestamp_meal_reviews
   Timing: BEFORE
   Events: UPDATE
   Function: public.update_timestamp()

ðŸ“‹ Trigger Definition:

âš™ï¸  Function Definition:

 RETURNS trigger
 LANGUAGE plpgsql

    NEW.updated_at = NOW();
    RETURN NEW;
END;
$function$

=========================================================
TABLE: meals
=========================================================

1ï¸âƒ£  CREATE TABLE Definition
-------------------------------------------------
CREATE TABLE public.meals (
    id integer DEFAULT nextval('meals_id_seq'::regclass) NOT NULL,
    name text NOT NULL,
    name_arabic text,
    description text,
    description_arabic text,
    section text NOT NULL,
    section_arabic text,
    base_price numeric(10,2) DEFAULT 0 NOT NULL,
    calories integer DEFAULT 0 NOT NULL,
    protein_g integer DEFAULT 0 NOT NULL,
    carbs_g integer DEFAULT 0 NOT NULL,
    fat_g integer DEFAULT 0 NOT NULL,
    fiber_g integer,
    sugar_g integer,
    sodium_mg integer,
    ingredients text,
    ingredients_arabic text,
    preparation_instructions text,
    image_url text,
    thumbnail_url text,
    is_premium boolean DEFAULT false NOT NULL,
    is_vegetarian boolean DEFAULT false NOT NULL,
    is_vegan boolean DEFAULT false NOT NULL,
    is_gluten_free boolean DEFAULT false NOT NULL,
    is_dairy_free boolean DEFAULT false NOT NULL,
    spice_level integer,
    prep_time_minutes integer,
    rating numeric(3,2),
    rating_count integer DEFAULT 0 NOT NULL,
    is_featured boolean DEFAULT false NOT NULL,
    discount_percentage numeric(5,2),
    discount_valid_until timestamp with time zone,
    is_available boolean DEFAULT true NOT NULL,
    created_at timestamp with time zone DEFAULT now() NOT NULL,
    updated_at timestamp with time zone DEFAULT now() NOT NULL,
    CONSTRAINT meals_pkey PRIMARY KEY (id)
);

2ï¸âƒ£  Constraints
-------------------------------------------------
â€¢ meals_calories_check (CHECK)
  CHECK ((calories >= 0))

â€¢ meals_base_price_check (CHECK)
  CHECK ((base_price >= (0)::numeric))

â€¢ meals_spice_level_check (CHECK)
  CHECK (((spice_level >= 0) AND (spice_level <= 5)))

â€¢ meals_sugar_g_check (CHECK)
  CHECK ((sugar_g >= 0))

â€¢ meals_rating_count_check (CHECK)
  CHECK ((rating_count >= 0))

â€¢ meals_sodium_mg_check (CHECK)
  CHECK ((sodium_mg >= 0))

â€¢ meals_rating_check (CHECK)
  CHECK (((rating >= (0)::numeric) AND (rating <= (5)::numeric)))

â€¢ meals_protein_g_check (CHECK)
  CHECK ((protein_g >= 0))

â€¢ meals_prep_time_minutes_check (CHECK)
  CHECK ((prep_time_minutes > 0))

â€¢ meals_fiber_g_check (CHECK)
  CHECK ((fiber_g >= 0))

â€¢ meals_fat_g_check (CHECK)
  CHECK ((fat_g >= 0))

â€¢ meals_discount_percentage_check (CHECK)
  CHECK (((discount_percentage >= (0)::numeric) AND (discount_percentage <= (100)::numeric)))

â€¢ meals_carbs_g_check (CHECK)
  CHECK ((carbs_g >= 0))

3ï¸âƒ£  Indexes
-------------------------------------------------
â€¢ meals_pkey (UNIQUE) (PRIMARY KEY)
  Columns: id
  Definition: CREATE UNIQUE INDEX meals_pkey ON public.meals USING btree (id)

â€¢ idx_meals_discount
  Columns: discount_percentage, discount_valid_until
  Definition: CREATE INDEX idx_meals_discount ON public.meals USING btree (discount_percentage, discount_valid_until) WHERE ((discount_percentage > (0)::numeric) AND (discount_valid_until > '2023-10-01 00:00:00+00'::timestamp with time zone))

â€¢ idx_meals_available_featured
  Columns: is_available, is_featured
  Definition: CREATE INDEX idx_meals_available_featured ON public.meals USING btree (is_available, is_featured) WHERE (is_available = true)

â€¢ idx_meals_calories
  Columns: calories
  Definition: CREATE INDEX idx_meals_calories ON public.meals USING btree (calories)

â€¢ idx_meals_protein
  Columns: protein_g
  Definition: CREATE INDEX idx_meals_protein ON public.meals USING btree (protein_g)

â€¢ idx_meals_rating
  Columns: rating
  Definition: CREATE INDEX idx_meals_rating ON public.meals USING btree (rating DESC) WHERE (rating IS NOT NULL)

â€¢ idx_meals_dietary
  Columns: is_vegetarian, is_vegan, is_gluten_free, is_dairy_free
  Definition: CREATE INDEX idx_meals_dietary ON public.meals USING btree (is_vegetarian, is_vegan, is_gluten_free, is_dairy_free)

4ï¸âƒ£  Triggers & Function Definitions
-------------------------------------------------

   Timing: BEFORE
   Events: UPDATE
   Function: public.update_timestamp()

ðŸ“‹ Trigger Definition:
CREATE TRIGGER trigger_update_timestamp_meals BEFORE UPDATE ON public.meals FOR EACH ROW EXECUTE FUNCTION update_timestamp()

âš™ï¸  Function Definition:
CREATE OR REPLACE FUNCTION public.update_timestamp()
 RETURNS trigger
 LANGUAGE plpgsql
AS $function$

    NEW.updated_at = NOW();
    RETURN NEW;
END;
$function$

CREATE TABLE public.order_items (
    id uuid DEFAULT uuid_generate_v4() NOT NULL,
    order_id uuid NOT NULL,
    order_meal_id uuid,
    item_id integer,
    quantity integer DEFAULT 1 NOT NULL,
    unit_price numeric(10,2) NOT NULL,
    total_price numeric(10,2) NOT NULL,
    name text NOT NULL,
    name_arabic text,
    category text,
    created_at timestamp with time zone DEFAULT now() NOT NULL,
    CONSTRAINT order_items_pkey PRIMARY KEY (id)
);

2ï¸âƒ£  Constraints
-------------------------------------------------
â€¢ order_items_order_meal_id_fkey (FOREIGN KEY)
  FOREIGN KEY (order_meal_id) REFERENCES order_meals(id) ON DELETE CASCADE

â€¢ order_items_item_id_fkey (FOREIGN KEY)
  FOREIGN KEY (item_id) REFERENCES items(id) ON DELETE SET NULL

â€¢ order_items_order_id_fkey (FOREIGN KEY)
  FOREIGN KEY (order_id) REFERENCES orders(id) ON DELETE CASCADE

â€¢ order_items_quantity_check (CHECK)
  CHECK ((quantity > 0))

â€¢ order_items_total_price_check (CHECK)
  CHECK ((total_price >= (0)::numeric))

â€¢ order_items_unit_price_check (CHECK)
  CHECK ((unit_price >= (0)::numeric))

â€¢ valid_item_total (CHECK)
  CHECK ((total_price = (unit_price * (quantity)::numeric)))

3ï¸âƒ£  Indexes
-------------------------------------------------
â€¢ order_items_pkey (UNIQUE) (PRIMARY KEY)
  Columns: id
  Definition: CREATE UNIQUE INDEX order_items_pkey ON public.order_items USING btree (id)

=========================================================
TABLE: orders
=========================================================

1ï¸âƒ£  CREATE TABLE Definition
-------------------------------------------------
CREATE TABLE public.orders (
    id uuid DEFAULT uuid_generate_v4() NOT NULL,
    user_id uuid,
    subscription_id uuid,
    order_number text NOT NULL,
    subtotal numeric(10,2) DEFAULT 0 NOT NULL,
    tax_amount numeric(10,2) DEFAULT 0 NOT NULL,
    discount_amount numeric(10,2) DEFAULT 0 NOT NULL,
    delivery_fee numeric(10,2) DEFAULT 0 NOT NULL,
    total_amount numeric(10,2) DEFAULT 0 NOT NULL,
    status order_status_enum DEFAULT 'pending'::order_status_enum NOT NULL,
    payment_status text DEFAULT 'pending'::text NOT NULL,
    payment_method payment_method_enum,
    payment_reference text,
    paid_at timestamp with time zone,
    delivery_address_id uuid,
    delivery_instructions text,
    scheduled_delivery_date timestamp with time zone,
    actual_delivery_date timestamp with time zone,
    delivery_driver_id uuid,
    contact_phone text,
    special_instructions text,
    coupon_code text,
    loyalty_points_used integer DEFAULT 0,
    loyalty_points_earned integer DEFAULT 0,
    created_at timestamp with time zone DEFAULT now() NOT NULL,
    updated_at timestamp with time zone DEFAULT now() NOT NULL,
    CONSTRAINT orders_pkey PRIMARY KEY (id)
);

2ï¸âƒ£  Constraints
-------------------------------------------------
â€¢ orders_tax_amount_check (CHECK)
  CHECK ((tax_amount >= (0)::numeric))

â€¢ orders_subtotal_check (CHECK)
  CHECK ((subtotal >= (0)::numeric))

â€¢ orders_subscription_id_fkey (FOREIGN KEY)
  FOREIGN KEY (subscription_id) REFERENCES user_subscriptions(id) ON DELETE SET NULL

â€¢ orders_payment_status_check (CHECK)
  CHECK ((payment_status = ANY (ARRAY['pending'::text, 'paid'::text, 'failed'::text, 'refunded'::text, 'partial_refund'::text])))

â€¢ orders_order_number_key (UNIQUE)
  UNIQUE (order_number)

â€¢ orders_loyalty_points_used_check (CHECK)
  CHECK ((loyalty_points_used >= 0))

â€¢ orders_loyalty_points_earned_check (CHECK)
  CHECK ((loyalty_points_earned >= 0))

â€¢ orders_discount_amount_check (CHECK)
  CHECK ((discount_amount >= (0)::numeric))

â€¢ valid_total (CHECK)
  CHECK ((total_amount = (((subtotal + tax_amount) + delivery_fee) - discount_amount)))

â€¢ orders_delivery_fee_check (CHECK)
  CHECK ((delivery_fee >= (0)::numeric))

â€¢ orders_delivery_address_id_fkey (FOREIGN KEY)
  FOREIGN KEY (delivery_address_id) REFERENCES user_addresses(id)

â€¢ orders_user_id_fkey (FOREIGN KEY)
  FOREIGN KEY (user_id) REFERENCES user_profiles(id) ON DELETE SET NULL

â€¢ orders_total_amount_check (CHECK)
  CHECK ((total_amount >= (0)::numeric))

3ï¸âƒ£  Indexes
-------------------------------------------------
â€¢ orders_pkey (UNIQUE) (PRIMARY KEY)
  Columns: id
  Definition: CREATE UNIQUE INDEX orders_pkey ON public.orders USING btree (id)

â€¢ orders_order_number_key (UNIQUE)
  Columns: order_number
  Definition: CREATE UNIQUE INDEX orders_order_number_key ON public.orders USING btree (order_number)

â€¢ idx_orders_user_created
  Columns: user_id, created_at
  Definition: CREATE INDEX idx_orders_user_created ON public.orders USING btree (user_id, created_at DESC)

â€¢ idx_orders_status_created
  Columns: status, created_at
  Definition: CREATE INDEX idx_orders_status_created ON public.orders USING btree (status, created_at DESC)

â€¢ idx_orders_delivery_date
  Columns: scheduled_delivery_date
  Definition: CREATE INDEX idx_orders_delivery_date ON public.orders USING btree (scheduled_delivery_date) WHERE (scheduled_delivery_date IS NOT NULL)

â€¢ idx_orders_number
  Columns: order_number
  Definition: CREATE INDEX idx_orders_number ON public.orders USING btree (order_number)

â€¢ idx_orders_payment_stats
  Columns: payment_status, paid_at
  Definition: CREATE INDEX idx_orders_payment_stats ON public.orders USING btree (payment_status, paid_at) WHERE (payment_status = 'paid'::text)

-------------------------------------------------
ðŸ”¥ TRIGGER: trigger_set_order_number
   Timing: BEFORE
   Events: INSERT
   Function: public.set_order_number()

ðŸ“‹ Trigger Definition:
CREATE TRIGGER trigger_set_order_number BEFORE INSERT ON public.orders FOR EACH ROW EXECUTE FUNCTION set_order_number()

âš™ï¸  Function Definition:
CREATE OR REPLACE FUNCTION public.set_order_number()
 RETURNS trigger
 LANGUAGE plpgsql
AS $function$
BEGIN
    IF NEW.order_number IS NULL THEN
        NEW.order_number := generate_order_number();
    END IF;
    RETURN NEW;
END;
$function$

CREATE TABLE public.plan_meals (
    id uuid DEFAULT uuid_generate_v4() NOT NULL,
    plan_id integer NOT NULL,
    meal_id integer NOT NULL,
    is_substitutable boolean DEFAULT true NOT NULL,

);

CREATE TABLE public.plans (
    id integer DEFAULT nextval('plans_id_seq'::regclass) NOT NULL,
    title text NOT NULL,
    title_arabic text,
    description text,
    description_arabic text,
    price_per_meal numeric(10,2) NOT NULL,
    short_term_meals integer NOT NULL,
    medium_term_meals integer NOT NULL,
    kcal integer,
    protein integer,
    carb integer,
    avatar_url text,
    is_active boolean DEFAULT true NOT NULL,
    sort_order integer DEFAULT 0 NOT NULL,
    created_at timestamp with time zone DEFAULT now() NOT NULL,
    updated_at timestamp with time zone DEFAULT now() NOT NULL,
    duration_days bigint DEFAULT '12'::bigint,
    additives integer[],
    CONSTRAINT plans_pkey PRIMARY KEY (id)
);

2ï¸âƒ£  Constraints
-------------------------------------------------
â€¢ plans_price_per_meal_check (CHECK)
  CHECK ((price_per_meal >= (0)::numeric))

â€¢ plans_target_calories_per_meal_check (CHECK)
  CHECK ((kcal > 0))

â€¢ plans_check (CHECK)
  CHECK ((medium_term_meals >= short_term_meals))

â€¢ plans_target_protein_per_meal_check (CHECK)
  CHECK ((protein > 0))

â€¢ plans_target_carbs_per_meal_check (CHECK)
  CHECK ((carb >= 0))

â€¢ plans_min_meals_per_week_check (CHECK)
  CHECK ((short_term_meals > 0))

-------------------------------------------------
â€¢ plans_pkey (UNIQUE) (PRIMARY KEY)
  Columns: id
  Definition: CREATE UNIQUE INDEX plans_pkey ON public.plans USING btree (id)

1ï¸âƒ£  CREATE TABLE Definition
-------------------------------------------------
CREATE TABLE public.user_profiles (
    id uuid DEFAULT auth.uid() NOT NULL,
    display_name text,
    phone_number text,
    avatar_url text,
    is_admin boolean DEFAULT false NOT NULL,
    loyalty_points integer DEFAULT 0 NOT NULL,
    notes text,
    language character(2) DEFAULT 'en'::bpchar NOT NULL,
    age integer,
    gender text,
    created_at timestamp with time zone DEFAULT now() NOT NULL,
    updated_at timestamp with time zone DEFAULT now() NOT NULL,
    last_login timestamp with time zone,
    email text DEFAULT ''::text,
    google_id text DEFAULT ''::text,
    account_status text DEFAULT 'active'::text NOT NULL,
    timezone text DEFAULT 'Asia/Riyadh'::text NOT NULL,
    phone_verified boolean DEFAULT false NOT NULL,
    email_verified boolean DEFAULT false NOT NULL,
    profile_completed boolean DEFAULT false NOT NULL,
    CONSTRAINT user_profiles_pkey PRIMARY KEY (id)
);

2ï¸âƒ£  Constraints
-------------------------------------------------
â€¢ user_profiles_loyalty_points_check (CHECK)
  CHECK ((loyalty_points >= 0))

â€¢ user_profiles_language_check (CHECK)
  CHECK ((language = ANY (ARRAY['en'::bpchar, 'ar'::bpchar])))

â€¢ user_profiles_id_key (UNIQUE)
  UNIQUE (id)

â€¢ user_profiles_gender_check (CHECK)
  CHECK ((gender = ANY (ARRAY['male'::text, 'female'::text, 'other'::text, 'prefer_not_to_say'::text])))

â€¢ user_profiles_age_check (CHECK)
  CHECK (((age > 0) AND (age < 150)))

-------------------------------------------------
â€¢ user_profiles_pkey (UNIQUE) (PRIMARY KEY)
  Columns: id
  Definition: CREATE UNIQUE INDEX user_profiles_pkey ON public.user_profiles USING btree (id)

â€¢ idx_user_profiles_phone
  Columns: phone_number
  Definition: CREATE INDEX idx_user_profiles_phone ON public.user_profiles USING btree (phone_number) WHERE (phone_number IS NOT NULL)

â€¢ idx_user_profiles_language
  Columns: language
  Definition: CREATE INDEX idx_user_profiles_language ON public.user_profiles USING btree (language)

â€¢ idx_user_profiles_last_login
  Columns: last_login
  Definition: CREATE INDEX idx_user_profiles_last_login ON public.user_profiles USING btree (last_login DESC)

â€¢ user_profiles_id_key (UNIQUE)
  Columns: id
  Definition: CREATE UNIQUE INDEX user_profiles_id_key ON public.user_profiles USING btree (id)

â€¢ idx_user_profiles_email
  Columns: email
  Definition: CREATE INDEX idx_user_profiles_email ON public.user_profiles USING btree (email)

â€¢ idx_user_profiles_google_id
  Columns: google_id
  Definition: CREATE INDEX idx_user_profiles_google_id ON public.user_profiles USING btree (google_id)

=========================================================
TABLE: user_subscriptions
=========================================================

1ï¸âƒ£  CREATE TABLE Definition
-------------------------------------------------
CREATE TABLE public.user_subscriptions (
    id uuid DEFAULT uuid_generate_v4() NOT NULL,
    user_id uuid NOT NULL,
    plan_id integer NOT NULL,
    status subscription_status_enum DEFAULT 'pending'::subscription_status_enum NOT NULL,
    start_date date NOT NULL,
    end_date date,
    price_per_meal numeric(10,2) NOT NULL,
    total_meals integer NOT NULL,
    consumed_meals integer DEFAULT 0 NOT NULL,
    delivery_address_id uuid,
    preferred_delivery_time time without time zone DEFAULT '12:00:00'::time without time zone NOT NULL,
    auto_renewal boolean DEFAULT false NOT NULL,
    payment_method_id uuid,
    is_paused boolean DEFAULT false NOT NULL,
    paused_at timestamp with time zone,
    pause_reason text,
    resume_date timestamp with time zone,
    created_at timestamp with time zone DEFAULT now() NOT NULL,
    updated_at timestamp with time zone DEFAULT now() NOT NULL,
    additives integer[],
    delivery_days timestamp with time zone[],
    meals json[],
    next_delivery_date timestamp with time zone,
    next_delivery_status text,
    delivery_history jsonb DEFAULT '[]'::jsonb,
    next_delivery_meals integer,
    CONSTRAINT user_subscriptions_pkey PRIMARY KEY (id)
);

2ï¸âƒ£  Constraints
-------------------------------------------------
â€¢ user_subscriptions_total_meals_check (CHECK)
  CHECK ((total_meals > 0))

â€¢ user_subscriptions_price_per_meal_check (CHECK)
  CHECK ((price_per_meal >= (0)::numeric))

â€¢ user_subscriptions_plan_id_fkey (FOREIGN KEY)
  FOREIGN KEY (plan_id) REFERENCES plans(id) ON DELETE RESTRICT

â€¢ user_subscriptions_payment_method_id_fkey (FOREIGN KEY)
  FOREIGN KEY (payment_method_id) REFERENCES user_payment_methods(id)

â€¢ user_subscriptions_delivery_address_id_fkey (FOREIGN KEY)
  FOREIGN KEY (delivery_address_id) REFERENCES user_addresses(id)

â€¢ user_subscriptions_consumed_meals_check (CHECK)
  CHECK ((consumed_meals >= 0))

â€¢ consumed_not_exceed_total (CHECK)
  CHECK ((consumed_meals <= total_meals))

â€¢ valid_pause_logic (CHECK)
  CHECK (((is_paused = false) OR ((is_paused = true) AND (paused_at IS NOT NULL))))

â€¢ valid_end_date (CHECK)
  CHECK (((end_date IS NULL) OR (end_date > start_date)))

â€¢ user_subscriptions_user_id_fkey (FOREIGN KEY)
  FOREIGN KEY (user_id) REFERENCES user_profiles(id) ON DELETE CASCADE

3ï¸âƒ£  Indexes
-------------------------------------------------
â€¢ user_subscriptions_pkey (UNIQUE) (PRIMARY KEY)
  Columns: id
  Definition: CREATE UNIQUE INDEX user_subscriptions_pkey ON public.user_subscriptions USING btree (id)

â€¢ idx_subscriptions_user_status
  Columns: user_id, status
  Definition: CREATE INDEX idx_subscriptions_user_status ON public.user_subscriptions USING btree (user_id, status)

â€¢ idx_subscriptions_active
  Columns: status, end_date
  Definition: CREATE INDEX idx_subscriptions_active ON public.user_subscriptions USING btree (status, end_date) WHERE (status = 'active'::subscription_status_enum)

â€¢ idx_subscriptions_active_with_delivery_days
  Columns: status, delivery_days
  Definition: CREATE INDEX idx_subscriptions_active_with_delivery_days ON public.user_subscriptions USING btree (status, delivery_days) WHERE ((status = 'active'::subscription_status_enum) AND (delivery_days IS NOT NULL))

â€¢ idx_subscriptions_active_with_next_delivery
  Columns: status, next_delivery_date
  Definition: CREATE INDEX idx_subscriptions_active_with_next_delivery ON public.user_subscriptions USING btree (status, next_delivery_date) WHERE ((status = 'active'::subscription_status_enum) AND (next_delivery_date IS NOT NULL))

â€¢ idx_subscriptions_delivery_history
  Columns: delivery_history
  Definition: CREATE INDEX idx_subscriptions_delivery_history ON public.user_subscriptions USING gin (delivery_history) WHERE (delivery_history IS NOT NULL)

â€¢ idx_subscriptions_pending_cleanup
  Columns: status, created_at
  Definition: CREATE INDEX idx_subscriptions_pending_cleanup ON public.user_subscriptions USING btree (status, created_at) WHERE (status = 'pending'::subscription_status_enum)

â€¢ idx_subscriptions_user_status_next_delivery
  Columns: user_id, status, next_delivery_date
  Definition: CREATE INDEX idx_subscriptions_user_status_next_delivery ON public.user_subscriptions USING btree (user_id, status, next_delivery_date)
